name_of_ordered_mutable_list.name: What is a ordered mutable list called?

ordered_mutable_list_start_number.name: What number does it start at?

ordered_mutable_list_can_be_inserted_in_.name: Can you insert into the middle of it?

name_of_unordered_mutable_list.name: What is a unordered mutable list called?

unordered_mutable_list_start_number.name: What number does it start at?

unordered_mutable_list_can_be_inserted_i.name: Can you insert into the middle of it?

name_of_ordered_immutable_list.name: What is a ordered immutable list called?

ordered_immutable_list_start_number.name: What number does it start at?

name_of_unordered_immutable_list.comment: `a` is the type of elements of the list
name_of_unordered_immutable_list.name: What is a unordered immutable list called?

unordered_immutable_list_start_number.name: What number does it start at?

name_of_mutable_hashed_list.name: What is a mutable hashed list called?

erase_element_from_mutable_hashed_list.name: Erase an element from the list

name_of_immutable_hashed_list.name: What is an immutable hashed list called?

create_a_immutable_hashed_list.code:
Set.empty
Set.fromList list
Set.fromAscList ascendingList
Set.fromDescList descendingList
Set.fromDistinctAscList list
Set.fromDistinctDescList list
create_a_immutable_hashed_list.name: Create the list

erase_element_from_immutable_hashed_list.name: Erase an element from the list

create_a_immutable_set.code:
import qualified Data.Map as Map
Map.empty
Map.singleton key value -- Map containing a single entry
Map.fromSet generateValueFromKey set
Map.fromList [(key1, value1), (key2, value2)]
create_a_immutable_set.comment: choose `Data.Map.Strict` or `Data.Map.Lazy` depending on your requirements
create_a_immutable_set.name: Create an immutable key/value set

find_element_by_value.name: Find/search for an element by value

find_minimum_element.comment: minimum works on all `Foldables` not just lists
find_minimum_element.name: Find the minimum value in a list

find_maximum_element.comment: maximum works on all `Foldables` not just lists
find_maximum_element.name: Find the maximum value in a list

convert_list_to_string.name: Convert a list to a string

duplicate_a_list.comment: Since you cannot mutate a list it is always going to be the same and you can refer to the original list
duplicate_a_list.name: Duplicate a list

duplicate_subset_of_list.name: Duplicate a portion/subset of a list

resize_list.comment: The list is always gonna be exactly as big as the number of elements that are in it
resize_list.name: Increase/decrease list size

do_two_lists_match_exactly.name: Do two lists match every element?

do_two_lists_contain_same_items.name: Do two lists contain all the same items?

does_list_satisfy_some_expression.code:
all testFunction foldable -- tests if all elements satisfy the `testFunction`
any testFunction foldable -- tests if any element satisfies the `testFunction`
does_list_satisfy_some_expression.name: Does a list satisfy some expression?

does_list_not_satisfy_an_expression.comment: You can easily achieve this with function composition of `all` or `any` and the `not` function
does_list_not_satisfy_an_expression.name: Does a list entirely not satisfy an expression?

shuffle_list.comment: This shuffles your list in a Monad, there are other shuffles available that use a RandomGenerator or a list of random integers to shuffle
shuffle_list.name: Shuffle list elements

filter.name: Filter a list based on criteria

reduce_left.code:
foldl function start foldable
foldl' function start foldable -- strict version of foldl
foldl1 function foldable -- folds taking the first element of the foldable as start
foldl1' function foldable -- strict version of `foldl1`
reduce_left.name: Reduce a list left-to-right

reduce_right.code:
foldr function start foldable
foldr1 function foldable -- folds taking the last element of the foldable as start
reduce_right.name: Reduce a list right-to-left
